snippet: Sunday’s vote in presidential and parliamentary elections in Serbia could determine whether the nation lurches back toward nationalism.
abstract: Runoff is expected in Serbian presidential race; visceral indignation with joblessness and arrogant political establishment benefits populist and nationalist parties as many voters turn toward onetime supporters of Slobodan Milosevic; biggest beneficiary is Tomislav Nikolic, former cemetery chief who has ties to Russia but recently has refashioned himself as pro-European keen on bolstering links with the European Union and United States.
lead_paragraph: Sunday’s vote in presidential and parliamentary elections in Serbia could determine whether the nation lurches back toward nationalism.

headline.seo: Populist Party Makes Gains in Serbian Elections
headline.main: In Serbia, a Populist Makes Gains in Elections Marked by Anger Over the Economy
headline.print_headline: In Serbia, a Populist Makes Gains in Elections Marked by Anger Over the Economy
